results.title: Cotton goods
results.creator_credit: Eastman Teaching Films and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Shows the picking, ginning, bailing, and sale of cotton; the carding, twisting, and drawing of yarn; the production of thread; the weaving and testing of cotton fabrics; and some of the multiple uses of cotton in everyday life.

results.title: Cotton by computer
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Researchers”.
At Narrabri in New South Wales, CSIRO scientists are collaborating with the State Department of Agriculture and cotton farmers in the cause of more efficient production of cotton. A computer based management system is helping them find the best ways of managing the cotton crop, to use fewer pesticides and to increase the harvest.

results.title: Cotton
results.brief_description: Shows hand and machine picking of cotton in the United States, followed by extraction of seeds by gin. Also explains how the cotton is baled, cleaned, fluffed, carded, spun into yarn, and finally woven into cloth.

results.title: Cottage gardens
results.creator_credit: Australian Broadcasting Corporation and Tracy Smith
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Gardening Australia”.
Jane Edmanson and the Gardening Australia team provide all the information you need to create your own cottage garden. Planting, planning and design techniques are shown, and suggestions are made in regards to which plants should go where and why.

results.title: Costume dresses from the True History of the Kelly Gang
results.brief_description: Crafted from used vintage fabrics and sourced from markets, the individualised dresses in True History of the Kelly Gang are likened to warpaint to scare the enemy by the film’s characters, but they also speak to their inner selves.

constellations_primary.name: Pink, Pose, punk, Pilgrim
constellations_primary.description: Alice Babidge's costume design for True History of the Kelly Gang sees the iconic foursome and their accomplices in dresses, a gender-expansive stance that connects to other rebellious outlooks on the world.

results.title_for_label: True History of the Kelly Gang costume dresses
results.headline_credit_for_label:
True HIstory of the Kelly Gang, Australia, 2020

Designed by Alice Babidge
results.description: Like the individualised armour in True History of the Kelly Gang, the dresses the outlaw Kelly Gang wear speak to their character’s inner selves. While the characters liken the dresses to a kind of warpaint to scare the enemy, costume designer Alice Babidge explained that “this was about finding a way for men or boys to wear dresses that didn’t feel camp – that felt strong or beautiful”. Bushranger Steve Hart’s (Louis Hewison) costumes draw the link between the armour and dresses, with both featuring a flower motif. To craft the dresses, Babidge used second-hand vintage fabrics, often sourced from markets.
description_for_label: Like the individualised armour in True History of the Kelly Gang, the dresses the outlaw Kelly Gang wear speak to their character’s inner selves. While the characters liken the dresses to a kind of warpaint to scare the enemy, costume designer Alice Babidge explained that “this was about finding a way for men or boys to wear dresses that didn’t feel camp – that felt strong or beautiful”. Bushranger Steve Hart’s (Louis Hewison) costumes draw the link between the armour and dresses, with both featuring a flower motif. To craft the dresses, Babidge used second-hand vintage fabrics, often sourced from markets.

results.title: Costa Rica
results.creator_credit: Japanese TV, UNICEF, Horst Cerns and Rolando Quiros
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Families of the world”.
Captures the flavour of life on a Costa Rican coffee plantation during harvest time when the whole family helps. At harvest’s end the family joins the village fiesta, parading by day and revelling by night.

results.title: Cost, profit & break-even (NP)
results.brief_description: John Cleese is joined by John Bird who explains to him why his factory which produces coupled cutlery has gone bankrupt. The film is designed to show the influence of the cost of a product on its price and how the volume produced affects that cost. Also considers how productivity is the only way to increase wages without increasing inflation. Intended for line managers, senior executives and personnel not directly concerned with finance. Suitable for upper secondary level. NB: FOR USE ONLY IN A DOMESTIC SITUATION OR FOR EDUCATIONAL PURPOSES ONLY.

results.title: Cosmopolis [NTSC]
results.creator_credit: Steeplechase Films, WGBH (Boston), Thirteen, WNET (Television station : New York, N.Y.), New York Historical Society, Ric Burns and Lisa Ades
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “New York: a documentary film”.
Episode 5: Cosmopolis (1919-1931) examines the roaring twenties, a period when New York finished assembling the components of a mass consumer society and emerged as the cultural capital of the world. In this short but dazzling period, New York became the focal point of an extraordinary array of human and cultural energies, reaching its highest levels of urban excitement and glamour. It discusses the African-American experience and the rise of new media industries. The series concludes with the skyscraper war, the stock market rise, the Crash, and- in the deafening silence that followed- the building of the Empire State Building, the greatest icon on the New York skyline. Narrated by David Ogden Stiers.
